Reviews.Title: “It's like a hostel”
Reviews.Author: JonathanTelAviv
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 bedroom apartment located in the center of Barcelona, in an nice but dated building. It looks exactly like the images. On arrival I had to wait for 30 minutes outside the building until someone let me in, payment is is in cash and in advance for the whole period. The rooms are small, beds are of low quality, there is not enough closet space and the living room has a stained tablecloth. THe free wifi, wasn't working most of the time, which was a real pain, because I didn't find free access points over the city. This place is ok only if you're on tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Variable quality of apartments”
Reviews.Author: JaydubAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona apartment we stayed in for 6 nights was just as it seemed in the photos, but we found the reality of living in it less comfortable than we expected - lighting was so poor that it was difficult to read at night, several light fittings had broken globes & we could see spare bulbs in a locked cupboard (which we could not access), no broom to sweep the floor (& given that we were the only cleaners during our stay the floor became very dirty) and the bathroom was certainly showing the wear and tear of constant use. However, the building was in a great location, the eccentric lift was a constant source of fun, and staying in an apartment meant that we could buy, buy, buy at the Boqueria Market & pretend for a few days that we did actually live in this wonderful city. The apartment could have been so much more comfortable with a bit of minimal maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great service, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: J2uk
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried about going here after reading a few of the reviews but just goes to show that some people are will moan about anything! I loved staying here and it was great value for money, so much so that we have booked out the whole apartment next year when I visit Barcelona again with some friends. There are two apartments above each other, we stayed in the top one and the apartment itself was cleaned every day, although I don’t think the rooms were, but I wouldn’t expect this for the price. The room was fine, simple and effective if you do not intend to spend much time in your room. The apartment had 2 bathrooms, and a WC, a breakfast area and a fully equipped kitchen which was very useful as although there is a cafe downstairs, it wasn't particularly cheap so sometimes we just had a quick breakfast in the room before we left for the day. The location was excellent and it is only a 5 min walk to the nearest tube stop which was Tetuan (one stop from Sagrada Familia) and there is parking outside the hotel for a moped if you rent one (by far the best way to see Barcelona). It can be a bit noisy at night as the road it is on is one of the main ones in Barcelona but this is easily solved if you just take some ear plugs. I can’t wait to go back again, Barcelona is a very cool place and the apartments are a great place to see everything from.

Reviews.Title: “Really good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MGer0000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in September. Great location, very central and convenient, with markets, shops, restaurants nearby. Ok, traffic is noisy but if you close the windows and shutters at night it blocks it out. There's a fan in eveyr room. Kitchen was spotless, as was common areas. We hardly saw our neighbours, nor did we hear any noise from any of the other apartments there. Rooms are very spacious, high ceilings, comfortable beds. It's not a hotel, so don't expect hotel service, with new sheets and towels every day, it's more like an upmarket hostel. I would definitely stay there again, and recommend it to anyone I know travelling to Barcelona. I know two people who stayed there in August, and they thought it was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not good value”
Reviews.Author: WinKz
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel via Venereal and a week before the trip, the manager emailed us for confirmation. That was nice but I also found out that they charge for late check-in. €25 after 9pm, €50 after 11pm. Thought this was quite steep but too late to rebook. The manager showed up when we arrived, and all was easy. Passed us the keys, and she spent 10mins walking through sights and recommendations. The room was small and basic, no tv, no cabinet, no table. We stayed there 3 nights and no change of sheets nor towels. Made a mistake first night I was there - did not fully close the balcony doors at night - to let the air in. Turned out the roads were busy all night with buses and ambulance. Closing it fully kept the noise out, and there is a standing fan in the room. The 2 showers/toilets were adequate, but I really did not appreciate how it was not kept clean nor dry. Also, when one of them ran out of toilet paper, it was not refilled during the days when we were there. Because of them dampness, they smelled rather bad. Location is good enough, about 15 mins walk to popular La Rambla, Old Town and Segrada Familia. Still feel that at this price, one can probably do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, between an hotel and a hostel”
Reviews.Author: Max M
Reviews.Content: We came at Apt Bcn for 5 days during september. You have to call when you arrive in Barcelona, so that they can send someone to give you the keys. This may be a problem if your sim card or your phone doesn't work abroad! Anyway, we were given a cold welcome by the manager, but she showed up to be quite helpful, by giving us advice on the "how-to" of BCN (pickpockets, ID card, streets to avoid), and handing us over a map on which she annotated the main touristic spots. The place is clean, it's a big appartment with locked and common rooms. You have the "hostel" feeling in the way that you share spaces with others, but everyone has it's private room, like in a regular hotel. The walls - as it is usually in old buildings - are not very big, so you may hear some noise from a couple ("hum, hum") or sweedish binge drinkers (which we experienced). They went anyway get wasted in clubs around midnight, so we slept very well everynight. The kitchen is clean and has everything you need, and our room was granted a big fan, so we were that hot. They view on the "avenida" is quite nice in the morning, if you are used to street sounds. Ho and I couldn't connect on the wifi, but that's wore because of my phone than the box I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “great shared apartment”
Reviews.Author: JFerguson
Reviews.Content: This is a shared apartment in a very good location in central Barcelona. Like any shared space, the experience often depends on who is staying there with you, but the facilities are nice and modern and the apartment and linens well kept and clean. Someone was there every day to clean the common spaces, including the kitchen and bathrooms. The manager is very helpful and gave us tips and advice when we checked in. All of her recommendations were helpful, including excellent restaurants outside of the usual tourist areas. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for young people, no so much for people over 30”
Reviews.Author: znieto
Reviews.Content: Love the location, very central. The only inconvenient was that I though it was a B&B, but it is just a room in an apartment to rent. If you are young, this is the best place, you can cook your own meals, great atmosphere, near to the discos, etc. However, I would recommended for people over 30s. I like comfort, peace and quietness, I didn't get them here. It is just like youth hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable accommodation in central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: woodsem
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay! The kitchen facilities are fantastic and the agents are extremely helpful. We had a triple room in this apartment but another friend joined us halfway through our stay so the agent booked us two twin rooms in another apartment nearby. This was also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Like at home”
Reviews.Author: Krzysiek23
Reviews.Content: It is a flat with 6 rooms, kitchen and 2 bathrooms. It has everything what you need to feel like at home. Kitchen in equipped very well. Stuff was very frinedly - we receive all the information we needed about sights in Barcelona. The hotel has great location - very close to Pl. Catalunya and metro stations. There is no reception - so you MUST confirm your reservation via phone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience!”
Reviews.Author: grzegorz_krol
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Apartments Gran Via for 3 nights and we must admit that we were really surprised how convenient things were there. The only disadvantage was that there were no bathroom in the room, but taking into consideration the fact GVA consists of 6 rooms only, 2 bathroom which they have are really enough for all guests. You can't avoid noise from the streets but two pairs of windows help a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, great location!”
Reviews.Author: G123Toronto
Reviews.Content: The room was functional and comfortable with a great balcony. The hotel was steps from the Metro and within minutes of Las Ramblas and the waterfront. We had a great time exploring the city from there. The staff was pleasant and very helpful. The only downside was that they could not arrange for a "take-away" breakfast for us to accommodate our early departure to the airport; other hotels we stayed at during our trip did make this arrangement for us. Oh well! There's always coffee at the airport!

HotelInfo.Name: Apartments Gran Via
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes 686, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
